Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Postoperative Antibiotic Duration in Complex Appendicitis

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients aged ≥8 years undergoing appendectomy for complex appendicitis were randomised

Participants.evidence: Patients aged ≥8 years undergoing appendectomy for complex appendicitis

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either 2 days or 5 days of intravenous antibiotics

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness of 2 days versus 5 days of postoperative antibiotics

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite of infectious complications and mortality within 90 days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using computerized block randomisation, stratified by center

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1066 patients were randomised, with 502 in the 2-day group and 503 in the 5-day group

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean difference in overall societal costs was –€625 (95% CI: –€958 to –€278)

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered in the Netherlands Trial Register (code NL5946)
